note.p: Education: St Alban Hall, Oxford (matriculated 1674); Merton College, Oxford; BA (1678), MA (1682)
Career: Travelled to Virginia; Rector of Crofton (1687); Prebendary of St Michan's, Dublin (1698); Dean of Kildare (1708-death)
References: Sir Kenneth Hutchison, 'The Royal Society and the Foundation of the British Gas Industry' in NR 1984-85 vol 39 pp 245-270
Notes: Henning says Sir Robert Clayton was FRS 1688 (as in Record); Bulloch says he was son of Captain Robert Clayton of Old Crook and Fulwood, Lancs
